context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.

generation: apply for financial assistance programs or funds from non-profit organizations that support patients who cannot afford their medication
appeal to local charities, non-profit organizations or social services for assistance
consider possible options like:
apply for financial assistance programs
contact the pharmaceutical company directly to inquire about any possible payment plans, discounts, or assistance programs that they may offer
reach out to charitable organizations or fundraising platforms to raise the necessary funds
seek help through various channels
try negotiating with the pharmacy or pharmaceutical company for a lower price or a payment plan
seek help from friends and family

explore various options such as applying for pharmaceutical assistance programs, seeking budget-friendly alternative medications, establishing a crowdfunding campaign for medication expenses, or discussing potential payment plans or discounts with the pharmacy or healthcare provider

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh could do is to
generation: call a taxi or an Uber to take him the rest of the way

call a taxi or use ride-hail service such as Uber or Lyft to get to the airport
call for a taxi, Uber, or any other ride service

call a taxi, ride-hailing service or a friend, ask for roadside assistance to take care of his car or rent a car on a nearby rental car service

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.
context_4.prompt: One thing that Mary could do is to
generation: explain the situation to her teacher honestly and ask if there is a possibility to submit the assignment a bit later, or she could quickly redo the assignment if time permits before the class
quickly call her mom and ask her to bring the assignment to school before the class starts
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit the homework
explain the situation to her teacher, apologize for the oversight, and then ask for an extension to submit her assignment
contact her mom and ask if she could bring the assignment to school
quickly explain the situation to her teacher and ask for permission to bring the assignment the next day
explain the situation to her teacher and ask if she may bring the assignment the next day once she retrieves it from home
quickly call her mom and ask her to bring the assignment to school if she has the time
contact her mom and ask if she could bring the assignment to school
contact her mother and ask if she can bring the assignment to her school

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad could do is to
generation: create a visible SOS signal that can be seen from the sky
start a fire to keep warm and signal for help
gather all the resources he and his friends have
start a fire for heat and to melt snow for drinking water
find a sheltered area, build a fire for warmth and signal for help, and ration the remaining food and water amongst the group
start building a makeshift shelter or improve the one they are currently using to keep warm
start a fire for warmth and to signal for help
build a shelter using materials around them to protect from the cold
gather everyone to discuss their situation, map out their surroundings, ration their remaining food and water, and find a way to signal for help
use their available resources to survive
